oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Knoxville College students, including two sons of President McCulloch
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Schools
African American students; African American women; Group portraits
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Posed on the steps of a brick building are five young men (two of whom are white) on the back row, four young women on front row, with an older white woman, possibly a teacher at front right.

Knoxville College President John Scuoller McCulloch became president of the newly-formed Knoxville College in 1877. Two of his sons were enrolled at the school. McCulloch was a Presbyterian minister who had served as a chaplain in the Union Army during the Civil War.
